title: Israel rejeita cessar-fogo com o Hezbollah ap√≥s press√£o pol√≠tica de extremistas, diz jornal - Estad√£o
text: O primeiro-ministro de Israel , Binyamin Netanyahu , rejeitou o acordo de cessar-fogo com o Hezbollah proposto pelos Estados Unidos depois de sofrer press√£o interna de membros do seu governo, noticiou o jornal israelense Hareetz nesta quinta-feira, 26. Segundo o Hareetz, Netanyahu, que viajou para Nova York para participar da Assembleia-Geral da ONU nesta sexta, havia feito compromissos verbais com os Estados Unidos de aceitar o acordo, mas recuou depois de ser pressionado por membros do seu governo. Publicamente, pelo menos um ministro israelense, Israel Katz (Rela√ß√µes Exteriores), descartou a possibilidade de um cessar-fogo. ‚ÄúN√£o haver√° cessar-fogo no norte‚Äù, escreveu Katz no seu perfil no X. ‚ÄúContinuaremos a lutar contra a organiza√ß√£o terrorista Hezbollah com for√ßa total at√© a vit√≥ria e o retorno seguro dos moradores do norte para suas casas.‚Äù Outro membro do governo, o ministro Bezalel Smotrich (Finan√ßas), tamb√©m fez declara√ß√µes que indicam a continuidade dos ataques israelenses ‚Äì e a consequente rejei√ß√£o do cessar-fogo. ‚ÄúA campanha no norte deve terminar com um cen√°rio: o esmagamento do Hezbollah e a elimina√ß√£o de sua capacidade de afetar os moradores do norte‚Äù, declarou. Smotrich faz parte da ala extremista do governo israelense, cujo apoio √© necess√°rio para a continuidade de Netanyahu no poder. O ministro √© citado pelo jornal The New York Times como um dos pol√≠ticos respons√°veis por travar o acordo de cessar-fogo na Faixa de Gaza, com a alega√ß√£o de que a guerra somente acabaria com a destrui√ß√£o total do grupo terrorista Hamas. ‚ÄúN√£o devemos dar tempo ao inimigo para se recuperar dos golpes duros que recebeu e se reorganizar para a guerra cont√≠nua ap√≥s 21 dias‚Äù, escreveu Smotrich no seu perfil do X. ‚ÄúA rendi√ß√£o do Hezbollah ou a guerra ‚Äî somente dessa forma traremos de volta os moradores e a seguran√ßa para o norte e para o pa√≠s.‚Äù Leia mais O acordo de cessar-fogo rejeitado foi constru√≠do pelos Estados Unidos e pela Fran√ßa depois da escalada da guerra na fronteira Israel-L√≠bano, que deixou quase 600 mortos somente na segunda-feira . Desde o fim da guerra civil do L√≠bano em 1990, o pa√≠s n√£o vivia um dia com tantas mortes. Pelo dois brasileiros morreram nos ataques . A escalada aconteceu ap√≥s Israel anunciar uma nova fase na guerra contra o Hezbollah, com quem est√° em conflito h√° 11 meses em consequ√™ncia da campanha militar na Faixa de Gaza. Os bombardeios ao longo da fronteira nesse per√≠odo for√ßaram a retirada de moradores do norte de Israel, o que aumentou a press√£o sobre o governo de Netanyahu, j√° criticado por falhas na seguran√ßa de Israel que permitiram o ataque terrorista de 7 de outubro e no resgate dos ref√©ns. O governo afirma que a nova fase contra o Hezbollah tem o objetivo de fazer o grupo recuar e garantir o retorno dos israelenses ao norte. O Hezbollah, no entanto, afirma que n√£o vai recuar da ofensiva com Israel at√© um cessar-fogo na Faixa de Gaza. A mil√≠cia xiita baseada no L√≠bano come√ßou os ataques na fronteira em apoio ao Hamas ap√≥s Israel iniciar a campanha militar na Faixa de Gaza em resposta ao ataque terrorista de 7 de outubro. A mil√≠cia tamb√©m n√£o respondeu √† proposta de cessar-fogo dos EUA. Entretanto, por n√£o ser um Estado, o grupo n√£o √© formalmente solicitado a aceitar a proposta. A intermedia√ß√£o acontece com o governo do L√≠bano. Enquanto as duas partes n√£o chegam √† tr√©gua, os ataques continuaram nesta quinta. O Ex√©rcito israelense afirmou que atacou alvos no sul do L√≠bano em resposta a uma bateria de foguetes disparados pelo Hezbollah contra o norte israelense nesta quarta. O minist√©rio da sa√∫de do L√≠bano disse que 20 pessoas foram mortas em um ataque a√©reo israelense em Younine, uma cidade no Vale do Bekaa, e que tr√™s pessoas foram mortas no distrito de Tyre, na costa mediterr√¢nea do pa√≠s. O ataque a√©reo em Beirute, que teve como alvo o comandante da unidade de drones do Hezbollah, matou duas pessoas e feriu outras quinze, de acordo com o minist√©rio. /Com NYT

author: Benjamin Lee
title: Opus review - John Malkovich plays an evil pop star in a silly horror dud
text:
The cult of celebrity is targeted in a progressively nonsensical and poorly made debut starring Ayo Edebiri Anyone who has written about a much-loved music star with even the vaguest hint of light criticism will be aware of the horrors that can often follow. The tribal intensity of extremely online and extremely sensitive fandoms can lead to either a mild torrent of more tolerable abuse or something far darker, like death threats and sometimes doxing, an unending rage erupting from people who use emojis as avatars. There's a great thriller to be made about this unpleasant tension, the fans who will do anything for their idol and the idol who will do nothing to stop them, but Opus, a poppy new A24 misfire premiering at Sundance, is not that movie.
It's the first film from the writer-director Mark Anthony Green, who, like many before him, is so fixated on what he wants to say that he hasn't been able to figure out how to say it. There's maybe a slicker, simpler and more satisfying murder mystery to be told here ‚Äì an assortment of media types picked off one-by-one at the remote ranch of a reclusive pop star ‚Äì but he's challenged himself with something far harder and ultimately too far out of his reach.
The pop star is Alfred Moretti (deliciously played by John Malkovich), who retreated from the public eye decades ago and has now returned with what he claims will be the greatest album ever made. In Willy Wonka style, he has invited a select few to his desert compound for an extravagant listening party ‚Äì an influencer (Stephanie Suganami), a paparazzo (Melissa Chambers), a rock star turned podcaster (Mark Sivertsen), a TV show host (Juliette Lewis), a magazine editor (Murray Bartlett) and, in a surprise twist, his inexperienced junior writer Ariel (Ayo Edebiri). She's felt a little hemmed in, pitching interviews that then are given to someone else, and is prepared to make‚Ä¶
Benjamin Lee

text: Un hombre de California pas√≥ diez d√≠as varado en las monta√±as despu√©s de perderse en una caminata, y tuvo que depender en parte de grandes vol√∫menes de agua para sobrevivir. Lo √∫nico que ten√≠a para sobrevivir en el bosque era la ropa que llevaba cuando se fue: ‚ÄúSal√≠ con s√≥lo un par de pantalones, mi par de zapatos para caminar y un sombrero‚Äù, le dijo a KABC. ‚ÄúTen√≠a una linterna y unas tijeras plegables, una especie de herramienta Leatherman. Atribuy√≥ su supervivencia a beber mucha agua de arroyos y cascadas que encontr√≥ mientras caminaba por el parque todos los d√≠as, mientras ped√≠a ayuda, seg√∫n KSBW, afiliada de CNN . ‚ÄúS√≥lo me asegur√© de beber un gal√≥n de agua todos los d√≠as, pero luego, cuando me acercaba al final, mi cuerpo necesitaba comida y alg√∫n tipo de sustento‚Äù, dijo McClish a KABC. Ver la cantidad de trabajadores de b√∫squeda y rescate que trabajaron para encontrarlo lo hizo sentir ‚Äúrealmente humilde‚Äù, dijo. "Fue una experiencia inrec√≠ble".

author: Stephen Langel
title: Trans community questioning future in Ohio after ban on gender-affirming care upheld | Ideastream Public Media
text: Alicia Burkle's family, including her daughter, who is transgender , has been hit hard by the Franklin Court of Common Pleas' Aug. 5 decision upholding a ban on gender-affirming care. "I would say we're pretty gutted right now," the Cleveland Heights resident said. "We were really, really hopeful, especially with the judge having put on the restraining order and hearing the case. We were really hopeful that he would have sided with the side of the trans youth, so it was a big blow to us yesterday to get the information that not only was it ruled that it was constitutional, but now it's effective immediately. It was really devastating." At issue is House Bill 68, which bans mental health care, medical care and social services for transgender youth. This includes the provision of puberty-blockers, which delay the changes of puberty in transgender and gender-diverse youth who have started puberty. The bill also bans trans athletes competing in girls' and women's sports. Proponents of the bill, including Ohio Rep. Gary Click (R-Vickery), lauded the court's decision. "This has been a long hard fight to protect minors in the State of Ohio," he said in a statement. "Sex change procedures, including dangerous drug interventions and surgeries, are a failed experiment that has been harming children around the world. Today, the Franklin County Court of Common Pleas upheld the right of the people of Ohio to ban such radical and risky procedures through their duly elected representatives." Burkle said lawmakers like Click are putting trans youth at risk. "They're politicizing the identities of these kids in such a negative way," she said. "Gender-affirming care is lifesaving. I would never ask someone to not get their child cancer care or diabetic care. I would be advocating for them to be able to get the care that will save their life and be affirming them. I would just ask for the same thing from these lawmakers." The problem is lawmakers have contempt for trans youth, said Dara Adkison, executive director of TransOhio. The legislation is "further stigmatization of just trans youth existence, because there's a very vocal minority of people who would like it if they didn't exist at all," they said. The ACLU of Ohio is appealing the Franklin County Court of Common Pleas decision. Beyond this bill, families are also concerned about other legislation, including a bill before the Ohio Senate banning trans youth from using bathrooms that match their gender identity, Burkle said. While she and her family want to stay in Ohio, bills like these make her question if that's possible. "I think our goal would be to stay where we are," she said. "Moving is not completely off the realm of possibilities, just because of other bills that are coming down the pike. So there's just more, more and more anti-trans legislation that we're keeping our eye on." The purpose of these bills is to make life as uncomfortable as possible for the trans community, Adkison said. "It is an intentional waterfall of an onslaught to try and make it as difficult as possible for our trans people and gender nonconforming people to exist in Ohio," they said, adding that the community will not be deterred. "There's no amount of legislation that can make us not exist," they said. "They can't make us go away. I'm sorry that our existence is such a such a problem for a small handful of legislators, but tough." TransOhio provides small grants for trans community members who may need to leave the state, including to receive gender affirming health care, Adkison added. HB 68 "really just strips their ability to live authentically and be who they are, their true selves," Burkle said. "It's no one else's place to say how another person identifies."

title: ‚ÄúCocon‚Äù : un manga sublime sur la survie en temps de guerre
text: Publi√©e en 2009, l‚Äô≈ìuvre de la dessinatrice Machiko Ky√¥ sort ce 19 janvier en France, aux √©ditions IMHO. L‚Äôoccasion de revenir sur ce one-shot magnifique qui d√©peint le quotidien tragique de jeunes infirmi√®res cherchant √† survivre √† la toute fin de la Seconde Guerre mondiale, alors que les Am√©ricains bombardent Okinawa. Tr√®s remarqu√© lors de sa parution au Japon, [Cocon](https://www.fnac.com/a18268141/Machiko-Kyo-Cocon) n‚Äôest pas √† proprement parler [un r√©cit de guerre](https://leclaireur.fnac.com/article/188697-les-reporters-de-guerre-qui-ont-racontee-lannee-2022/). Il s‚Äôagit plut√¥t d‚Äôune histoire centr√©e sur la r√©silience et les tentatives de survie des h√©ro√Ønes. √Ä la fois tragique et [intimiste](https://leclaireur.fnac.com/article/273209-raconter-lintime-episode-2-avec-mathilde-lemiesle-ce-qui-releve-de-lintime-doit-etre-raconte/), il nous propose de d√©couvrir la vie (mais √©galement la mort) de l‚Äôescadron Himeyuri, un groupe de jeunes Japonaises mobilis√©es en 1945 pour servir de personnel m√©dical dans les √Æles tropicales de l‚Äôextr√™me sud de l‚Äôarchipel japonais. La douceur comme rem√®de √† l‚Äôenfer sur Terre San est une lyc√©enne mobilis√©e pour aller soigner des soldats dans un h√¥pital de fortune install√© dans une grotte, √† l‚Äô√©t√© 1945. La guerre est d√©j√† perdue, il n‚Äôy a plus ni nourriture ni m√©dicaments pour soigner les combattants. Pourtant, la jeune fille et ses amies parviennent tant bien que mal √† garder le moral, malgr√© les bombes, les fusillades, les incendies et la d√©gradation quotidienne de la situation. Au fil de rares moments de r√©pit, de jeux entre amies ou de r√™veries sur un avenir possible, San arrive √† se cr√©er un ¬´ cocon ¬ª pour se couper de la brutalit√© d‚Äôun quotidien rythm√© par la perte de plus en plus fr√©quente de coll√®gues et d‚Äô√™tre chers. Moins de 20 % des Himeyuri ont surv√©cu √† l‚Äô√©t√© 1945, un fait que Cocon ne cherche jamais √† adoucir. Au fil des chapitres, qui s‚Äôacheminent vers un pic de brutalit√© alors que l‚Äôimminence de la fin du conflit se profile, ces instants suspendus hors du temps deviennent une question de survie pure et simple pour ne pas sombrer dans le d√©sespoir. Un titre peu connu en France, mais un indispensable de l‚Äôautomne Avec son trait extr√™mement doux, ses cases o√π [l‚Äôhorreur surgit brutalement](https://leclaireur.fnac.com/article/360358-la-selection-halloween-2023-3-films-a-voir-pour-commencer-le-mois/), et son histoire oscillant entre onirisme et sc√®nes de trag√©die extr√™mement crues, il est √©vident que le style de Machiko Ky√¥ est inhabituel. Il est m√™me assez √©loign√© de l‚Äôid√©e que l‚Äôon se fait d‚Äôun manga de guerre. C‚Äôest pr√©cis√©ment ce qui fait la force de Cocon, qui nous livre une histoire compl√®te en 15 chapitres dont on ressort chang√©. Les derniers instants de l‚Äôintrigue nous livrent ainsi un message particuli√®rement percutant et fort bien ex√©cut√© sur la capacit√© √† surmonter un traumatisme, √† reprendre un semblant de vie normale apr√®s un encha√Ænement de drames et √† continuer √† garder espoir. Davantage que de deuil, il s‚Äôagit d‚Äôun manga sur la puissance de l‚Äôamiti√© et de l‚Äôamour comme bou√©e de sauvetage face √† une situation inextricable. Machiko Ky√¥ s‚Äôest d‚Äôailleurs inspir√©e de plusieurs histoires r√©elles et de t√©moignages d‚Äôhabitants d‚ÄôOkinawa pour cr√©er un groupe de personnages coh√©rents et vraisemblables, li√©s par cette volont√© de survie et cette force de r√©silience. Ce type de r√©cit, m√™lant trauma et po√©sie, a d‚Äôailleurs fait la notori√©t√© de cette mangaka au Japon. Cocon a ainsi √©t√© pr√©sent√© √† de [nombreux festivals artistiques](https://j-mediaarts.jp/en/award/single/cocoon/) et son autrice a remport√© un prestigieux prix Tezuka pour sa seconde s√©rie, publi√©e en 2013. Vers une adaptation anim√©e Manga devenu culte dans l‚Äôarchipel, Cocon fera certainement reparler de lui d‚Äôici un an, car une adaptation sous forme de s√©rie anim√©e prestigieuse vient d‚Äô√™tre annonc√©e. Elle sera r√©alis√©e en partenariat avec la NHK (l‚Äôaudiovisuel public japonais) et le studio Sasayuri, [un centre de formation](https://www.wacom.com/ru-fr/events/connected-ink-2021/stories/sasayuri) lanc√© en 2021 pour former de nouveaux animateurs de talent et produire des anime innovants. Au pilotage du projet, on retrouvera une certaine Hitomi Tateno, ancienne animatrice de [Ghibli](https://leclaireur.fnac.com/article/218994-le-parc-a-theme-ghibli-ouvre-enfin-ses-portes-a-linternational/) qui a fourni un travail exemplaire sur [Mon voisin Totoro](https://www.fnac.com/o8412181/Mon-voisin-Totoro/w-4) ou Kiki la petite sorci√®re. Un projet tr√®s ambitieux, donc, qui devrait √™tre diffus√© √† l‚Äô√©t√© 2025 √† l‚Äôoccasion des 80 ans de la fin de la guerre du Pacifique. En attendant d‚Äôen savoir davantage sur cette future s√©rie anim√©e, on ne peut que vous recommander de vous pencher sur la r√©cente traduction fran√ßaise de cette ≈ìuvre violente, mais empreinte d‚Äôun humanisme et d‚Äôune vague d‚Äôespoir bouleversante qui vous restera en m√©moire pour de nombreuses ann√©es.

author: David Jones
title: Eustis installs lightning detection alarms at several parks
text:
Eustis installs lightning detection alarms at several parks
"It's an outdoor town, so that'll work well, I think."
"It's an outdoor town, so that'll work well, I think."
"It's an outdoor town, so that'll work well, I think."
This week, Eustis installed three lightning detection systems at area parks as a way to warn parkgoers of impending lightning storms so they can take shelter.
The systems were installed at Carver Park, Ferran Park (the Eustis Aquatic Center) and Sunset Island Park (the Eustis Service Center).
But the systems, while they are mainly designed for lightning strikes, also serve another public safety function: the ability for staff to quickly broadcast messages to the public at the park during emergency situations.
The systems are equipped with bullhorns and cameras and cost the city approximately 72 thousand dollars.
"It was something I felt the city needed, the parks and recreation department needed for the safety of our participants," said Parks and Recreation Director Sam Brinson.
"The horn will sound, our staff will try to come out and clear the park for the safety of the participants."
The systems will be able to track lightning within a 10 mile radius, and will sound the horn one time for the initial warning and three times when the threat has passed and it is safe to resume activities.
The next steps, Brinson said, include the city installing signage at the three parks to let parkgoers know of the new alarms.
"It's something that should be standard for all parks and recreation departments," Brinson said. "Where I came from, in Miami, almost every department, parks and recreation department had lightning detection systems in their parks."

title: Call of Duty soll Verdansk wieder ruinieren: ‚ÄûMassives L und Wiederholung der Vergangenheit"
text:
Call of Duty soll Verdansk wieder ruinieren: ‚ÄûMassives L und Wiederholung der Vergangenheit‚Äú
Mit dem Reloaded-Update von Season 3 kommen die umstrittenen Vertical Ascenders wieder nach Verdansk. Laut der Community haben die Warzone damals ‚Äûget√∂tet‚Äú.
Die gro√üe R√ºckkehr von Verdansk in Call of Duty: Warzone hat dem angeschlagenen Battle Royale neues Leben eingehaucht. Spielerzahlen explodierten, als die ikonische Map mit Season 3 ihr Comeback feierte. Doch nun droht mit dem kommenden Mid-Season-Update ein Feature zur√ºckzukehren, das bei vielen Spielern heute noch f√ºr Albtr√§ume sorgt: Vertical Ascenders. Die Community ist gespalten: Es soll Campen verhindern, aber f√ºr andere stirbt die Taktik im Shooter. Activision rollt unbeirrt am 1. Mai das neue Update aus.
Vertical Ascenders in Verdansk: Warum die Community das Warzone-Feature f√ºrchtet
Die Vertical Ascenders erm√∂glichen es Spielern, schnell auf D√§cher und hohe Positionen zu gelangen ‚Äì ein Feature, das laut vielen Veteranen bereits in der ersten Verdansk-√Ñra negative Auswirkungen hatte. ‚ÄûLustigerweise war dies der erste Schritt, um Warzone beim ersten Mal zu killen‚Äú, kommentiert ein besorgter Spieler auf Reddit. Ein anderer erg√§nzt: ‚ÄûDie Vertical Ascenders (oder die absurde Anzahl davon) machten das Spiel damals schlechter, nicht besser.‚Äú
Die Kritik richtet sich vor allem gegen die potenziell hohe Anzahl dieser Aufz√ºge und die damit verbundene Ver√§nderung der Spielmechanik. Viele bef√ºrchten, dass die sorgf√§ltig ausbalancierte Verdansk-Map durch zu viele Aufstiegsm√∂glichkeiten ihr taktisches Gameplay verlieren k√∂nnte. ‚ÄûEs gibt bereits mehrere Wege auf die D√§cher. Ascenders sind ein massives L und eine Wiederholung der Vergangenheit‚Äú, warnt ein weiteres Community-Mitglied.
Dach-Camper im Visier: Trotz der Skepsis gibt es auch Stimmen, die die R√ºckkehr der Vertical Ascenders begr√º√üen. ‚ÄûGut, das Spiel kann so langweilig sein, wenn alle Leute nur in und auf Geb√§uden sitzen‚Äú, verteidigt ein Spieler die Neuerung. F√ºr diese Fraktion stellen die Aufz√ºge ein notwendiges Werkzeug dar, um dem in Verdansk verbreiteten ‚ÄûRoof-Camping‚Äú entgegenzuwirken.
Die Diskussion spiegelt ein grundlegendes Dilemma wider: W√§hrend Camper auf D√§chern f√ºr viele ein √Ñrgernis darstellen, sehen Taktik-Fans in den begrenzten Zugangswegen zu erh√∂hten Positionen ein wichtiges Balancing-Element. Die Community scheint in dieser Frage tief gespalten ‚Äì ein Reddit-Post zum Thema zeigt mit 656 Upvotes und 622 Downvotes eine fast perfekte Teilung der Meinungen.
Season 3 Reloaded bringt mehr als nur Ascenders: Diese Features erwarten Warzone-Spieler
Neben den umstrittenen Vertical Ascenders bringt das Mid-Season-Update am 1. Mai zahlreiche weitere Neuerungen nach Verdansk. Der Verdansk Train Station kehrt zur√ºck, inklusive eines Zuges, der √ºber die Map f√§hrt und als mobile Lootquelle und Transportmittel dient. Mutige Spieler k√∂nnen sich auf die neuen ‚ÄûHigh Value Loot Zones‚Äú freuen, die besonders wertvolle Ausr√ºstung versprechen ‚Äì allerdings mit erh√∂htem Risiko.
Zus√§tzlich f√ºhrt Activision zwei neue Auftragstypen ein: Train Recon und Big Game Bounty. Besonders spannend f√ºr kompetitive Spieler: Battle Royale Ranked Play kommt erstmals in der Geschichte von Verdansk auf die Map. Hier k√§mpfen 50 Teams mit je drei Spielern um Skill Rating Punkte, die durch Eliminierungen, Herausforderungen und √úberleben verdient werden k√∂nnen.

title: Nico Gonzalez presented to the press as new Juventus player |Juventus-fr.com
text:
Nico Gonzalez, who scored last Tuesday in the Champions League match, was presented to the press a little while ago as a new Juventus player.
His first goal with Juventus:
¬´ I am very happy, it was a dream for me to score with this jersey. It was a dream for me to score with this jersey. It is also the right moment to win the match, I am very happy. ¬ª
His role on the ground:
¬´ As I said the other time, we know what to do, we have a clear idea: to be free, to take responsibility for each other, what to do on the pitch. That‚Äôs what gives the right result. That‚Äôs why we won. That‚Äôs what the coach asks (‚Ä¶) To play good football. The ball on the ground. That‚Äôs what we want. To get a positive result, that‚Äôs what we have to do. We all want, as a group, to have an idea. I said it. The idea is clear. We are united, compact, we are a good group, and that‚Äôs what will bring a positive result. ¬ª
His role on the ground:
¬´ When you play football, you are happy. If I have to be a goalkeeper, I do it without any problem. That is my answer. ¬ª
His complicity with Dusan Vlahovic:
¬´ Yes, I know him. He has improved a lot, really a lot. When I saw him in the first game, I said: guys, he is really strong. He hasn‚Äôt scored a goal in three games, but he is always positive, he helps the team, he is a good guy who deserves the best. If I can give him assists, that‚Äôs perfect. It‚Äôs the same for me. He is doing very well (‚Ä¶) Our idea is clear. We help the team. That‚Äôs our job. It‚Äôs not about scoring goals, helping, but doing our best for the team. We have to continue with this team, which brings positive results. That‚Äôs all there is to it. ¬ª
Objective Scudetto?
¬´ We are Juventus. We can‚Äôt think about tomorrow. We live in this moment and we think game by game. That‚Äôs the idea. I don‚Äôt want to think about what‚Äôs next. It doesn‚Äôt work like that. To be mentally healthy, you have to think game by game. ¬ª
The season is going to be long:
¬´ For us it‚Äôs great, we are all young people who want to play. So many games is good for the team. As I heard the coach say: for this we have to rest, eat well, sleep well. Three clear objectives. ¬ª
His integration into Juventus:
¬´ I am happy, I found a great group, good guys. I have been part of the team since day one. Thank you for that. ¬ª
The Juventus version Thiago Motta:
¬´ Impressed by Juve and Thiago? He impressed me a lot, I didn‚Äôt imagine anything else, I know how Juve works. I spoke a lot with Paredes, Dybala, Soul√©, Di Maria. There were many Argentines who passed through here, who are now teammates in the national team. They explained to me how everything works, the organization. I also thank him, he is great, he made me feel like a son. Thiago? He is incredible. He gives me the freedom I need to enjoy every game, every training session. I also want to thank him. ¬ª
The upcoming clash against Naples:
¬´ Of course, we want a positive result. I keep saying the same thing as before, we work day after day, training after training. When the match comes, we are ready. We have to think like that. ¬ª
